docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's governors demanded today that Congress and President Bush take immediate action to slow the explosive growth of Medicaid, which they say has become unsustainable in its current form. Medicaid dominated discussions today at the winter meeting of the National Governors Association. State officials sounded a note of desperation as they sought ways to control health spending.

headline.main: Governors Say States Need More Federal Help to Deal With Rising Costs of Medicaid

docs.abstract: Medicaid dominates discussions at winter meeting of National Governors Assn; nation's governors demand that Congress and Pres Bush take immediate action to slow explosive growth of Medicaid, which they say has become unsustainable in its current form; governors advance numerous proposals to control Medicaid spending and plead with federal government for financial help; photo (M)
